content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-075-16-A |Item_parent=Smoking addiction |Item_parent_short=Smoking addiction |Rank=A |Title=Knowing the epidemiology of smoking and the main tobacco-related diseases |Description=None |Rubric=Epidemiology |Contributors= |Order=16}} Recent trends in smoking : * In 2017 and again in 2018, the proportion of smokers fell by 12% after several years of stability. * 11 million smokers in 2018 There are many contributing factors, including * The price has risen sharply, * the neutral packet * or the "No Smoking Month" operation. Daily and occasional smoking: (among 18-75 year olds in 2018) * 32% smokers, including 25.4% daily smokers and 6.6% occasional smokers

question.title: What was the percentage of smokers in 2018?

option_a.title: The percentage of smokers in 2017 and 2018 increased by 12%.
option_a.description: This option is incorrect, but plausible

option_b.title: The proportion of smokers fell by 12% in 2017 and 2018, and 11 million smokers remained in 2018.
option_b.description: This option is correct, but wordy

option_c.title: The price of cigarettes has not risen sharply in recent years.
option_c.description: This option is incorrect, but plausible

option_d.title: Smoking has become more popular among 18-75 year olds in 2018.
option_d.description: This option is incorrect, but plausible

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: Select the correct letter of the answer
